text: - ANTONINA: Hello, Jerzyk.- JERZYK: Good morning, Miss.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Come along, Adam. Time for morning rounds.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What a beautiful girl you are.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Good morning, darling.- Good morning, Punia.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Have you come to help me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: LUTZ HECK: The torchlightwas flaring in front of me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Behind me, I could hear the breathingof a maddened creature.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It was midnight, black as coal.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I couldn't see my hand in front of me,but I could feel her breath on my neck.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I had interfered, and she was angry with me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I thought it was the end of me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I took my rifle, raised it,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - and that's when she charged.- (STOMPS FOOT)
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: There was nothing I could do,I had to shoot her.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It was the picture of perfection.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But I have to say, her cubs did survive.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They thrived, and have grown toa proud maturity in my zoo. Cheers.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Herr Heck has taken overthe Berlin Zoo from his father.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And his brother runs the Munich Zoo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Would you like a canapé, Herr Heck?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It looks delicious, but no. Thank you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This is Magda Gross, the sculptress.Perhaps you know of her.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: WANDA: And what do you dowith yourself, my dear,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: while your husband is playingwith his monkeys?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Sweetness is the least of it.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We met five or six years ago,didn't we, Frau Zabińska?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I think you've changed your hair.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You've only grown more beautifulin these past years, I have to say.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The look of a stray barn cat, if you ask me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Did you know that barn cats havethe keenest sense in all of nature?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: More astute and fine thanany human being I hope to meet.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Do you play the piano, Frau Zabińska?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Why don't you play something for us?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I think it's the perfect time tosoothe the savage beast and all that.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Maybe she should play a German waltz.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We may all be learningthe goose-step within a year.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Stefan, please.- STEFAN: Isn't that so, Herr Heck?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I wouldn't know anythingabout it, I assure you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm a zoologist, not a politician.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Mama, Jerzyk needs you! It's Kasia.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Be quiet, don't startle her.- (KASIA TRUMPETING)
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Here, stay here.Hold the light steady for me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I can bring you overalls, Miss, please.I can find other men.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: ANTONINA: There's no time. She's suffocating.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Please, let me help you, my darling.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: JERZYK: I have no rifle, Miss, please!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, please, let me do this.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm trying, Kasia. I'm trying, my darling.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - You should go. You can go.- Why isn't that man armed?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - LUTZ HECK: What's his name?- Tembo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Tembo! Tembo. Good. Good, good, good.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We're losing her! Jerzyk, help me!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: That was hard work, wasn't it?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's all right. It's all right, sweetheart.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You are a wonder, Punia.You are Eve in her garden.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Mama, what are those men doing?They look like mules.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: ANTONINA: We were on Nalewki Street today.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They're working the Jewslike pack animals now.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I think you should take Rysout of Warsaw tomorrow.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You could stay with my cousins in Zalesie.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We should get Rysout of the city while we can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Oh, he's so excited, Jan,with his new pencils, and his shoes...
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You're not listening to me.I'm trying to tell you something.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's feeling very dangerous to me right now.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I have to stay for the animals,but I'll come as soon as I can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Punia, Hitler and Stalin have signed a pact.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Only Poland sits in the middle.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We could stay in Zalesie for a little while,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: but if war comes, we have to finda way out of the country.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't want to run away.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't want to carry Rys from placeto place, like a frightened cat.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm sorry, Punia. Come back to me, come here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: People always want to run whenthey don't know what's coming.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's their first instinct, always to run.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Come.- It's not good for a child.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's not good, Jan, I'm telling you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't want Rys to live that way.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Please, I want to stay here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - RYS: But where's Papa?- He's in Płońsk.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - No, Rys, leave him!- No, I don't want to.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - We'll open the doors.- He's scared.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He'll run somewhere safe. Let's go!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This is the Polish Army.Wild animals are loose.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Take the boy, Miss, please! Go, go!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No! Don't shoot him, don't shoot him!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Excuse me, where is the train to Zalesie?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: MAN: (ON PA) No trains running today!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No trains today!Leave the station immediately.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: ANTONINA: I can't believe you found us.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Hey. Maybe you'd like to fly. Come.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Oh, you poor things.You must have been so scared.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: GENERAL ROMMEL: The German governmenthas taken charge of the Polish people.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We rely on the population of Warsaw
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: to accept the entry of German forces
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: JAN: They're usingour enclosures as an armory.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I was raised with these people.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It didn't matter to my family.It never mattered to me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You know, we weren't expecting you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm so sorry. My husband's not here, so...
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your zoo is to be liquidated.I'm sorry to tell you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't understand what you mean.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But I see a way out of this, my friend.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But you need to listen to me now.You need to trust me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Now, I could take your prize animalsto Germany as a loan.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You know you can trust my word on this.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And when the war is over,I can return them to you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But what if the war comes to Germany?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A terrible thought, I know,and a personal nightmare for me,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: but I must tell youthe Allied forces are very weak.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I expect this to be over very soon.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I want to rescue the best of your breeds.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And I can secure them a futureno matter what might come.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And we can do this together, Frau Zabińska.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We can save your animals together.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Of course we must do it.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'll bring trucks as soon as I can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your animals will be fine.I give you my word.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't know how to thank you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's from one animal lover to another, hmm?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Lutz Heck is taking all the animals?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, just the prize stock, for safekeeping.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Ah, but that's our stock, Punia.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: That's all that's left to keepthe zoo in operation.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Why didn't he wait to speak to me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He said he didn't have time.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: So, I gave him our permission.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He doesn't need our permission, Punia.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Don't you see? He's Hitler's head zoologist.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Put him in Herr Heck's truck.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: ANTONINA: "The rich shoemaker in the town
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: "took the measureof the little foot into his own room
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: "in which stood great glasscases full of pretty shoes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: "She sat down and made,well, as well as she could,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I think Papa's home in timefor New Year's Eve.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: These creatures won't survive the winter.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's an order from high command.There's nothing I can do.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Tell me, where's the owner?- He's gone.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Would you tell his wifeI'd like to talk to her?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I thought I saw her.I must have been mistaken.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Dr. Korczak?- Not too far now.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: SZYMON: They're forcing Jewsout of their homes,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and they are taking us all to the ghetto.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They dragged Maurycy awaylike he was a criminal.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: That brilliant, kind man,like he was nothing.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We're going to go where theywant us to go, that's all.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And when the war is over,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I've known you since we were boys, Jan.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Go on, Szymon. What do you need from me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'd like to keep my insectcollection here with you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I can't take it with me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I want it to be safe.It's my life's work, you know that.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Of course, Szymon, yes.We can put it in the basement.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's dry there, like a dungeon.And no one will find it.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This is a Jew hiding in our house.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We can't even give her a glass of water.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We could be shot for a glass of water.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: So, we just close our eyes and let her go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Our dearest friend in all the world.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We would have to be sure about this.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We'd have to be very sure.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: JAN: Absolutely no sound during the morning.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No sound, do you understand me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - The cook leaves at 1:00.- She'll sleep in the day.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: At midnight, the patrol leaves,and then you can come out.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I have nowhere else to go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They've moved all the Jews behindwalls in the Nalewki District.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And they're bringing in very little food.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - ANTONINA: Oh, my God.- And no wood, nothing for the cold.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Have you heard anything about Maurycy?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He's practicing law from a storefront.That's all I know.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I can't get through the gates, Magda.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No one enters the ghetto without a pass.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They have trucks, they have guns.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And they want to usethe zoo as a way station.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A place to hide Jews, until safehouses can be found for them.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A friend is different, one friend.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But more than one? That's dangerous, Jan.You said it yourself.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They are trapped and starvinglike rats in a cellar.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They'd be our guestsuntil we found them refuge.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We have to keep the groundsin operation, or we're lost.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But whatever it is, whatever we do,we have to hide it in plain sight.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We understand the war officeis going to close our zoo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: An unfortunate consequenceof the occupation. I'm really sorry.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Well, of course we want to save it if we can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We've spent many years building it.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What do you propose, Frau Zabińska?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Uh, we need to keepthe zoo in operation, Lutz.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We'll raise pigs in the pensto feed your men,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and we will save our zoo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Pigs. Well, they're cheap to farm,of course, but how would you feed them?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We could collect garbage from the ghetto.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Of course, with your permission.- (LIGHTER CLICKS)
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your zoo's been of value. That's very true.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your bison was exquisite.A perfect specimen, and a terrible loss.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I've spoken of it to Hermann Göring,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and I'm happy to saythat he's agreed with me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I am to start a breeding program this summer.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, that plan has no scope, no ambition.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, I intend to breedaurochsen from the bison.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But they have been extinctfor 300 years, Lutz.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: That's exactly the point.I intend to bring them back.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I didn't know that you thoughtso little of me, Dr. Zabiński.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I devoted my life to the study of genetics,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and I'm well practicedin the study of animal breeding.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm an expert in that field.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And I think I know more than anyone.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Herr Göring must respect you very much.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Oh, I believe he does, yes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Well... (CLEARS THROAT)I think the pigs will work.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm sure Göring will bepleased with the idea.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And what an irony,a trayf farm fed by Jewish garbage.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Draw them into the pen, and close the gate!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But be careful, he's in a temper.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We thought of your zoo,but we had to fight the war office.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And then you came knocking on my door,as if you could read my mind.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You paved the way with pigs.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What a crack-brained idea,and what splendid luck for us!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We can keep our eye on himwith the bison here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Well, he trusts you, that's clear.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You have a way with him.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't know how I can ask you to do this.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm going to do it, that's all.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The feed's ready for the pigs. I have to go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's the pig farmer of Warsaw.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's pig meat. Put it away.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: So, how is Magda? Is she all right?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What could I do? I had no choice.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: There's a young girl back there.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And two soldiers are with her.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't know what will happen now.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What do they intend to do with us, Jan?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We need the peelings for our soup.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Dr. Korczak.- I'm sorry, we have nothing else to eat.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, no, I should have realized.Uh, may we speak privately?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - I might be able to help you.- Yes, of course.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's pig meat. I'll bring more when I can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: People know your books.They will take care of you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You should leave with me, Dr. Korczak.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But then what of the children?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: My heart is no different than yours.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I should not be here,they should not be here,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I can help you.You have to be very, very quiet.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Here, go in, go, go.- (MOANING IN PROTEST)
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We will show you into a tunnel.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And you will spend the night there.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The German patrol comes backshortly after dawn.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But you will be woken before thatand taken outside of Warsaw.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Through the tunnel. Go through the tunnel.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: There's a cook that comes every morning.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Please, you can't make a sound.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Will you tell me your name?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A new hiding place can feel strange.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But I promise you,you're going to be all right.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'll stay with you if you like.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - The army's waiting for them in Łomża.- Good luck.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: If you tell me your family name,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Maybe we could bring them here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What a terrible time you must have had.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He was shot in St. Petersburg.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Me, I was about your age.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We were taken in by friends sometimes,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We were running for so long.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And no one knows how hard it is,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You can never tell who your enemies are,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Maybe that's why I love animals so much.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and you know exactly what's in their hearts.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Most of the animals are gone nowbecause of the bombing.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Women and childrenwill stay here in the basement,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: until we can find a safe housethat can take you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We shall sleep in the morningswhen the cook is here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I will play my piano after midnight,and then you'll know it's safe to come out.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: But if you hear the pianoin the day, you must hide.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Would you please make a double batch of soup?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: LUTZ HECK: We'll mate them this summer.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Mmm-hmm.- She'll be in estrus a short time.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Yes, a day at most.- Exactly.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Well, I'm afraid I've worn you outwith all our talk.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Oh, not at all. I've enjoyed your company.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Still, I think it's time to go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We haven't much time, Mrs. Aszer.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your friends are waiting for you in Łódź.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Goodbye, cousin! Visit us again soon!

text: ...but I was never good at it.

text: I hope someday, you'll teach me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: My father used to say it.

text: What a surprise.I wasn't expecting you today.

text: Of course. Always a good surprise.

text: I have another surprise for you.

text: Take the rope, keep her calm.

text: I must have left them in the pen.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Well, put them on, please.You're not a child.

text: I'm Dr. Ziegler. I'm the directorof the Ghetto Labor Bureau.

text: I've come to see the bugs.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Szymon and I went hunting many times.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm a bit of a bug man myself.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: An amateur entomologist, you might say.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It exploded in his stomach.He couldn't be saved.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's such a tragedy for me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I respected him very much indeed.

text: The ghetto walls were built againstour Labor Bureau building.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: One opens into the free side of the city,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: In one way, out the other, you understand me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I will give you papers that willgive you access either way.

text: Dr. Zabiński, welcome to the Labor Office.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You can take the workers out,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I will see that they are signed back in.

text: This is Dr. Zabiński. He works for me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You will allow him throughwhenever he comes or goes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Look, this is Dr. Zabiński,he's allowed to pass through every time.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I look forward to working with you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Bring them out. Bring as many as you can.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What do you mean? He works for me.I'm Dr. Jan Zabiński.

text: Yes, but who is he?I've never seen him before.

text: Do you want me to go to the Labor Bureau?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Do you want me to wasteDr. Ziegler's time, his valuable time,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: to have him come all the way here,to talk to you,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: to tell you that he is with me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You agree to have me here?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You will be in great danger.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The female's strong.She'll give birth in spring.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Did he bathe you, Punia?Did he wash your hands?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Don't be silly. What should you be sorry for?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I want to do what's right.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: My heart is filled with it,my stomach with such loathing.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And I don't know what to do.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Our lives are turned upside down.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: How can any of us know anything now?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Miss, I can't find any jars of beans, or...
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You must continue to use your ointment,Mrs. Zabińska, for your hands.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Just as I instructed.Now, I will check your pulse.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Pietrasia, do you mind?- No, no, no.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm sorry, Doctor. I didn't see you come in.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You know, we've had to let mostof the zookeepers go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You have always been so good to me,Miss. You and your husband.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Now, I'll be good to you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Tomorrow the evacuationof the ghetto will begin.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Pack your belongings,and prepare for resettlement.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And now, listen to an old story.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I wrote it for you. It's a children's tale.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We are going to a land called Ro,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: to visit a great magician there.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: His name is Zi.He's a very good friend of mine.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: (QUIETLY) Dr. Korczak,my car is outside the gate.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I need your help now,or the fear will be unmanageable.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: LUTZ HECK: Look who's joined the party.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What will the pig farmer do now, I wonder.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He comes here whenever he likes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He touches you however he likes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What would you have me do?I can't send him away.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We have to work with him, we agreed.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It was the only way to do this.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I never agreed to this. Never.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This dance you do with him.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This fun little game you play.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You don't even see it. He frightens me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I am here with a housefull of desperate people,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and he comes here and he frightens me,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And there's nothingI can do. You're not here.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And you are here.You stay hidden here, safe and sound.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You don't know. You don't know.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And I'm trying to help them,but they're dying in my hands.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You don't know what it's like.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Here, down on your knees. On your knees.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Someone at the boarding housemust have turned them in.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: BROADCASTER: (ON RADIO)On this day, the 19th ofApril, 1943,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: on the eve of Adolf Hitler's birthday,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: the final extermination of the Warsaw Ghetto.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Join our brothers and sisters in the fight.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: For on this day,our ghetto will be liquidated.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The Warsaw Ghetto will be no more.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Today is April the 19th.Passover begins tonight.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Here's cash and papers.We'll move Mrs. Mayzel to Bramki.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: They're taking Mrs. Poznanskato Foksal Street.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You never let me go anywhere.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I bet it's cold out there.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: How long has he been there?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A week. I mean, a month.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: A month? That's a long time.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I thought I just saw him the other day.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: No, I told you. He's in Zalesie.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I like to swim there, in the lake.It's beautiful.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I bet you wanted to go swimming, too.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And that's why you yelledat your father on Zurawia Street.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I wasn't supposed to leave the zoo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I want to speak to your motherand your father.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Your parents must be proud of you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Tell them they should be proud of you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I've named her Teresa, like the saint.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: (STAMMERING) Oh, that's a good name.That's a beautiful name.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: BROADCASTER: (ON RADIO)This is Warsaw calling. This is Warsaw calling.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The Polish Home Armyis rising up against the Nazi Reich.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We call on all great citizens of Warsaw
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: to free our city and our nation.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The German Army must not stand.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: This is Warsaw calling.This is Warsaw calling.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I was told that he was shot in the neck.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The Germans took him to a prison camp,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: but no one knows where he is.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: BROADCASTER: (ON RADIO) This is Warsawcalling. This is Warsaw calling.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Citizens of Warsaw,we urge you to leave at once.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The city is no longer safe foryou.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I repeat, you are not safe.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We urge you to take only what you can carry.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: and the German Army is expected to fall.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You are not safe. This is Warsaw calling...
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Herr Heck's taking the bison out of Warsaw.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Miss, you're not leaving the zoo.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I have to know what happened to Jan.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The war's turning.I've been ordered back to Berlin.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We'll be sorry to see you go.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I'm here to ask you, my friend,
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He was captured by German troops.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He was taken from the zoo?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: The underground army'sfighting in the Old Town.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Jan was buying grass and he was captured.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Why are you really here, Antonina?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: (VOICE BREAKING)I hoped you might help me find him.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: As a gift to our friendship.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't know. I don't know anything.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And what gift would I receive in return?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Has Jan been keeping secrets from me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Are you lying to me, Antonina?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I just want to findwhat happened to my husband.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: And if he's dead, I want to bury him.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: "Hitler ist kaputt!" I heard your son say it.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It means nothing to him, it's a game.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: He hears thingsand he repeats them, that's all...
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - People come and go all the time...- Who comes and goes?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Believe me, it means nothing to him.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Did he hear it from his father? Did he?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I can see it in your eyes.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: what else have you been hiding from me?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What have you been up to,Frau Zabińska, in your little zoo?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: We have to get them out. Herr Heck is coming.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - (SPEAKING GERMAN)- Herr Heck wants you out.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Pack your things. They're coming!Hurry, they're coming!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Yeah, go quickly.- Go to the truck.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Quickly, please, go. You must hurry!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Come back when the war's over, promise me.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: She's coming with us! Go quickly, boys!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: - Rys, get in the truck.- No, I'm not going.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Take Teresa, we'll catch up to you.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Yes, please, go! I'll find you, quick!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Go downstairs, hide. Don't make a sound.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I said, drop your weapon now.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Lock her in. Lock her in!
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: Do what he says. Do exactly what he says.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: What kind of man shoots an innocent child?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You have no idea what kind of man I am.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: You're a man of intelligence and of breeding.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: (VOICE BREAKING) Not the kindof man that would shoot a child.
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: I don't think I can walk.Can you help me, sweetheart?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife

text: It's my home, son, hmm?Where else would I go?
title: The Zookeeper's Wife
